revised_title: John Hunter's Controversial In Vitro Fertilization Experiments in Bombyx Mori
tldr: The author discusses John Hunter's 18th-century experiments on in vitro fertilization in Bombyx mori, the silk moth. Hunter claimed success in artificially impregnating and hatching moth eggs, but modern attempts to replicate his methods have been unsuccessful. The author reflects on the reliability of Hunter's findings and the ongoing challenges of in vitro fertilization in various species.
